post_title: [-TAVSN-] - New Credit Card Ad Purchase Page
post_text:
Advertisement

I have some great newstechnology

In anticipation of the inevitable Paypal account restrictions, I am adding new purchase options to my sites. All of my sitescan make purchases using Paypal and Payza right now.

As a member of Commissions Unleashed or Your Lucky Fast Cash, your options are now expanded to include Paypal, Payza, VISA, Mastercard , AMEX, and debit cards for ad purchases.

Here are the priority projects for the new credit/debit card payment options
1. Order Ads page forCommissions Unleashed -done
2. Order Ads page for Your Lucky Fast Cash - 90% complete
3. Order Ads page for OneStopSolos -next to be done
4. OTO, Special Offer, and Upgrade pages for Commissions Unleashed, Your Lucky Fast Cash OneStopSolos,Freedom Mails
5. SuperNetwork Solo purchases all sites

I will be adding credit/debit card payment options next for One Time Offers, Special Offers, and upgrades.

I will continue to use Paypal until officially notified that we can no longer use their services for purchases or payments.

However, there are alternatives in place right now:

1) Payza, used for both purchases and commission payments, and...

2) A brand new page that allows purchases by all major credit and debit cards. Access this page using the "Order Ads" button, right below "Start Here" on the NAV menu.

I am also working on a Bitcoin solution, and Mass Pay via Payoneer.

Despite the turmoil being thrust upon the Home Business industry, I intend to take preemptive measures to ensure business continuity.

REQUIRED ACTIONS

Be sure to update your profile with your Payza (formerly called Alert Pay) account information. Payza accounts are free, and even though the verifications seem tedious and unnecessary, once you are verified transferring funds is painless.

The new Order Ads page requires no action - you will have to supply your credit/debit card information with every purchase.

We will persevere. This has been the culmination of about 50 hours of programming to integrate merchant account payment buttons to allow me to accept credit/debit cards.

Rich Moyer
Owner and Admin
Commissions Unleashed
Your Lucky Fast Cash
Freedom Mails
WebcastSource
OneStopSolos
Giant Profit Ads
Mad Cow Ads

post_title: [-TAVSN-] - Hooray for PayPal for protecting us
post_text:
Advertisement

PayPal has been making changes to their policies and you need to be aware what is happening.

Many marketers are experiencing "Limitations" on their accounts

Here is a brief history.
Last year PayPal added digital goods to their list of items that they warrant and protect the buyer.
Before this change digital goods were outside their warranty and the buyer of digital goods was on his own and seldom has any recourse to a refund etc.

After the digital goods were moved into the same group as tangible goods, PayPal in effect was at risk for any high risk digital goods and they soon discovered some of them.

They responded by making changes to keep their risk in control.

They took a look at the high risk sitesand refused to do business with them.

Seems to me that PayPal is continuing to examine every site with a PayPal Pay button on it. And I mean every site.

This is great news for all honest marketers. When the smoke clears we will do even better.
And the removal of these scams will be good for all of us.

PayPal's
Prohibited Activities can be found by clicking the word legal at the bottom of any PayPal page

Summary:

  • Avoid any site that makes wild or outlandish promises or get rich quick statements.
  • Be careful ofpyramid or ponzi schemes, matrix programs, other "get rich quick" schemes or certain multi-level marketing programs as noted in the Prohibited Activities
  • Be careful of any site that does not accept PayPal it might be a high risk site

I am proud of PayPal for having the courage to tackle this problem and PayPal is simply trying to lower their risk and protect you and me in the process.

Joe Freyaldenhoven
Get the rest of the details by clicking the credits link

post_title: [Earn 10 Credits] - Hooray for PayPal for protecting us
post_text:
Advertisement

PayPal has been making changes to their policies and you need to be aware what is happening.

Many marketers are experiencing "Limitations" on their accounts

Here is a brief history.
Last year PayPal added digital goods to their list of items that they warrant and protect the buyer.
Before this change digital goods were outside their warranty and the buyer of digital goods was on his own and seldom has any recourse to a refund etc.

After the digital goods were moved into the same group as tangible goods, PayPal in effect was at risk for any high risk digital goods and they soon discovered some of them.

They responded by making changes to keep their risk in control.

They took a look at the high risk sitesand refused to do business with them.

Seems to me that PayPal is continuing to examine every site with a PayPal Pay button on it. And I mean every site.

This is great news for all honest marketers. When the smoke clears we will do even better.
And the removal of these scams will be good for all of us.

PayPal's
Prohibited Activities can be found by clicking the word legal at the bottom of any PayPal page

Summary:

  • Avoid any site that makes wild or outlandish promises or get rich quick statements.
  • Be careful ofpyramid or ponzi schemes, matrix programs, other "get rich quick" schemes or certain multi-level marketing programs as noted in the Prohibited Activities
  • Be careful of any site that does not accept PayPal it might be a high risk site

I am proud of PayPal for having the courage to tackle this problem and PayPal is simply trying to lower their risk and protect you and me in the process.

Joe Freyaldenhoven
